title: Greta Thunberg Among Hundreds From Gaza Aid Flotilla Deported by Israel
description: Israel intercepted the boats at sea and detained the participants for days before expelling them. Some of the activists say they were mistreated, which Israel denied.

title: Trying to Survive Gaza’s War-Torn Present, and Hoping for a Future
description: Two years of intense warfare in Gaza has left its people with a dismembered and disordered society. The destruction is vast and many Gazans have mental and physical wounds that could scar a generation.

title: Syria Chooses a Parliament of Revolutionaries
description: In the first elections since the Assad regime was ousted, there was no popular vote and women and minorities won few seats. Still, many Syrians saw it as progress toward ending authoritarian rule.

title: Syria Chooses a Parliament of Revolutionaries
description: In the first elections since the Assad regime was ousted, there was no popular vote and women and minorities won few seats. Still, many Syrians saw it as progress toward ending authoritarian rule.

title: Israel and Hamas Meet in Egypt to Discuss Gaza Peace Plan
description: Though significant issues remain to be hashed out between Israel and Hamas, some are saying that after two years of death and destruction, a breakthrough may be near.

title: Hurricane Priscilla intensifying off southwest Mexico. Maps show forecast path.
description: Priscilla strengthened into a hurricane Sunday and was getting stronger early Monday, forecasters said.

title: Israel and Hamas begin indirect Gaza ceasefire talks in Egypt
description: President Trump wants Israeli and Hamas negotiators to "move fast" in new talks aimed at securing a ceasefire in the Gaza war, spurred by his 20-point plan.

title: Japan’s New Leader Gets a Volatile Greeting From Markets
description: The governing party’s unexpected choice of Sanae Takaichi as its leader and Japan’s likely next prime minister caused the yen to weaken and stocks to soar on Monday.

title: CBS News on board as China intercepts Canadian air force mission
description: China sent fighter jets to intercept a Canadian air force plane tracking North Korean ships breaching U.N. sanctions.

title: French appeals court revisits Gisèle Pelicot rape case
description: An appeals court in France is hearing the case of a man sentenced to nine years in prison for his role in a drugging and rape trial.

title: French Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu Resigns
description: Sébastien Lecornu’s departure ratcheted up pressure on President Emmanuel Macron to call snap parliamentary elections.

title: Fishermen in Caribbean fear for their lives and jobs amid U.S. strikes
description: Fishermen in Trinidad and Tobago are fearing that a U.S. military strikes in the Caribbean could kill them and their livelihoods.

title: In a New Memoir, an Israeli Captive Looks Ahead with Hope
description: Freed after 14 months, Eli Sharabi learned that his family didn’t survive the Oct. 7 attacks. “Hostage” is testimony to his suffering and his hope.

title: Almost 15 million teens around the world using vapes, WHO report says
description: More than 100 million people around the world are using e-cigarettes, according to "alarming" estimates from the World Health Organisation, with almost 15 million teenagers believed to vape.

title: Greta Thunberg among Gaza aid flotilla activists deported as Israel-Hamas peace talks begin
description: Activists including Greta Thunberg were met with cheers as they arrived at a Greek airport on Monday, after being detained in Israel, and then deported, for taking part in a Gaza-bound aid flotilla.

title: Sanae Takaichi set to become Japan's first-ever female prime minister
description: Japan is set to get its first female prime minister, and conservative Sanae Takaichi will have complex political juggling to do from day-1 to keep the job.

title: Russia Welcomes Trump’s Blessing of Proposal to Extend Caps on Nuclear Weapons
description: President Trump said a Russian proposal to extend by one year the limits on long-range nuclear weapons sounded “like a good idea to me.”

title: Hacks at Marks & Spencer, Jaguar Land Rover and Co-op Disrupt UK Daily Life
description: Jaguar Land Rover is the third big British brand to have its operations severely affected by a breach this year.

title: Sudanese militia leader convicted of war crimes in Darfur
description: The leader of a militia that carried out a series of atrocities and war crimes in the Sudanese region of Darfur has been convicted by the International Criminal Court.

title: Ukraine’s Secret Weapons Spending Faces Questions After Internal Review
description: The government reviews show the country’s challenge as U.S. support wanes and Kyiv pivots to production from a domestic arms industry with a long history of corruption.

title: Ukraine 'strikes oil terminal in Crimea and key Russian explosives factory'
description: Ukraine's military says it has struck one of Russia's main explosives factory as well as an oil terminal in Russian-occupied Crimea.

title: Trump’s Gaza Peace Plan: What to Know
description: Israel and Hamas said they will work with President Trump’s proposal to end the Gaza war. But persistent sticking points could derail a diplomatic breakthrough.

title: 3 scientists win Nobel Prize in medicine for discoveries in immunology
description: Nobel Prize committee chair says discoveries by the trio of researchers were "decisive for our understanding of how the immune system functions."

title: U.K. police probe arson attack on mosque as possible hate crime
description: U.K. police are treating a fire at a mosque as a possible hate crime in an incident that came just days after a deadly terrorist attack outside a synagogue.

title: Nobel Prizes 2025: What to Know
description: The awards are being announced this week.

title: The Pelicot Trial: A Timeline
description: Dominique Pelicot was convicted of drugging and raping his wife, Gisèle Pelicot, and of inviting dozens of men to rape her. Here is how the events unfolded.

title: Macron under pressure to call parliamentary elections after French PM quits
description: Sebastien Lecornu's resignation has come kind of completely out of the blue - and there doesn't seem to be an obvious reason for it.

title: Latest on potential deal to end war between Israel, Hamas as violence continues
description: A deal could soon be reached to end the war in Gaza between Israel and Hamas and return the hostages. However, Hamas has not commented on disarmament, which is a key Israeli demand. CBS News' Debora Patta reports.

title: CBS News gets inside look at mission tracking North Korean ships and China's response
description: CBS News was invited on a U.N. air mission, searching for North Korean ships that may be violating sanctions by carrying banned goods like oil and weapons. China is suspected of helping North Korea evade sanctions. CBS News' Anna Coren reports.

title: Egypt probes loss of a second ancient artifact to thieves in a month
description: Just weeks after a pharaoh's 3,000-year-old bracelet was stolen, officials in Egypt say an even older piece of art has vanished from a tomb wall.

title: French prime minister resigns, prompting far-right to demand new election
description: The resignation of another French prime minister deepens the country's political crisis and draws a call from far-right leader Marine Le Pen for national elections.

title: President Trump and the Supreme Court
description: Today, we look ahead at the potential consequences of the Supreme Court term that begins today.

title: Who are the seven prime ministers who have served under France's Macron?
description: France's prime minister Sebastien Lecornu has resigned after just 27 days.

title: Pilots Demand India Ground Boeing 787s to Investigate Use of Emergency System
description: The ram air turbine, used when electrical power or hydraulic pressure fails, was deployed during an Air India flight that landed safely over the weekend. The same system had been activated during a flight that crashed in June.

title: Appeal could extend mandatory prison term for Australia mushroom murderer
description: Prosecutors say a woman convicted of murdering family members with toxic mushrooms was given a "manifestly inadequate" sentence, and they want it extended.

title: Rape case that shook France returns to court for lone appellant's trial
description: Less than a year after a landmark verdict in a drugging and rape trial that shook France, an appeals court is set to hear the case of a man challenging his conviction.

title: Exploring the Burren, Ireland’s Vast Rocky Region
description: Though it looks forbidding, the Burren, where you can walk for hours among the rocks and valleys with only your thoughts for company, can be fertile ground for creativity.

title: Rescuers helping hundreds of Mount Everest hikers trapped by heavy snow
description: Rescue workers were helping hundreds of hikers trapped by heavy snow at tourist campsites on a slope of Mount Everest in Tibet, Chinese state media said.

title: 10/5: CBS Weekend News
description: Americans fed up with how Trump, GOP and Democrats are handling shutdown, poll finds; Second life for California trees burned in wildfires

title: Snowstorm Traps Hundreds of Everest Hikers
description: The snowfall buried tents and reduced visibility. The local authorities said that they were in contact with the hikers and that rescue efforts were underway.

title: Pakistan Fights Its Fiercest Taliban Insurgency in a Decade
description: Pakistan uprooted the Taliban with U.S. help in the 2010s. But the insurgency has resurfaced with assistance from the Afghan Taliban.

title: Floods and Landslides in Nepal Worsen Woes of a Nation in Flux
description: Last month, nationwide protests ousted the government. Now, Nepal’s interim leaders are dealing with heavy rains that have snarled transportation and killed dozens.

title: Andrej Babis Likely to Return as Czech Prime Minister After Parliamentary Win
description: The party of Andrej Babis, a billionaire and a skeptic of military support to Ukraine, prevailed in parliamentary elections by focusing on the economy.

title: Gunman fired up "50 to 100 shots" on busy Sydney street, police say
description: Acting New South Wales Police Superintendent Stephen Parry said "anywhere between 50 and 100 shots" were fired during the incident.

title: Typhoon Matmo Makes Landfall in Southern China
description: The tropical cyclone disrupted transportation, forced more than 151,000 evacuations and raised fears of flooding as it barreled toward Guangdong Province.

title: 10/1: CBS Evening News Plus
description: What to know about federal task force arrests in Memphis; Reporter's Notebook: Did Trump and Hegseth's words move America's top generals?

title: Trump urges Gaza peace deal negotiators to "move fast" ahead of Cairo talks
description: Tuesday marks two years since the Hamas terrorist attack on Israel on Oct. 7, 2023, that sparked the war.

title: High pressure as work begins on Israel-Hamas hostage release logistics
description: Talks around the logistics of a hostage-prisoner swap between Israel and Hamas begin Monday in Egypt. Debora Patta is in East Jerusalem with the latest.

title: Malnourished children fill this hospital - where parents fear what might come next
description: You can see, feel, hear the distress in Badakhshan's Provincial Hospital in Afghanistan.

title: Rubio Says U.S. Wants Quick Deal to Bring Gaza Hostages Home
description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio said talks on a U.S. plan to end the Gaza war are focused now on hostages, with other difficult issues to be left for later, he said.

title: Macron Appoints French Cabinet, but Doubts Over Government’s Stability Persist
description: There were significant holdovers from the previous cabinet, but President Emmanuel Macron also named several newcomers, including Bruno Le Maire, a veteran centrist politician, as defense minister.

title: Strong-Armed by Trump, Netanyahu Embraces Gaza Deal as a Personal Win
description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel took credit for an emerging agreement, but it was clear that President Trump was calling the shots.

title: Rubio says release of hostages from Gaza is "most emergent and immediate phase" of Trump peace plan
description: "Let's discuss through the mediators the logistics and the mechanics behind how that happens, and that has to happen very quickly. That cannot drag on," Secretary of State Marco Rubio said.

title: Fire at Peacehaven Mosque Is Being Treated as Hate Crime, UK Police Say
description: The attack came at a time of heightened anxiety after a deadly terrorist attack at a synagogue in Manchester.

title: Leader of U.K. Conservatives Vows to Deport 150,000 People a Year
description: Kemi Badenoch, whose party is sinking in polls, outlined plans resembling Trump policies against those accused of being in the United States illegally.

title: Hamas Partially Accepts Trump’s Peace Plan
description: Hamas said it would release all Israeli hostages but wants to negotiate elements of President Trump’s peace plan for Gaza. Adam Rasgon, a reporter for The New York Times in Jerusalem, explains where negotiations stand.

title: Transcript: Secretary of State Marco Rubio on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," Oct. 5, 2025
description: The following is the transcript of the interview with Secretary of State Marco Rubio that aired on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" on Oct. 5, 2025.

description: The following is the transcript of the interview with Sen. Chuck Schumer that aired on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" on Oct. 5, 2025.

description: The following is the transcript of the interview with House Speaker Mike Johnson that aired on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" on Oct. 5, 2025.

title: Transcript: Retired Lt. Gen. Ben Hodges on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," Oct. 5, 2025
description: The following is the transcript of the interview with retired Lt. Gen. Ben Hodges that aired on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" on Oct. 5, 2025.

title: Rubio says release of hostages from Gaza is "most emergent and immediate phase" of peace plan
description: With negotiations in Cairo set to begin on Monday between Israel and Hamas, Secretary of State Marco Rubio told "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that Hamas' release of hostages is the "most emergent and immediate phase" of the proposed peace plan. "That has to happen very quickly — that cannot drag on," he added.

title: Negotiations between Israel and Hamas begin Monday around hostage-prisoner swap
description: Negotiators between Hamas and Israel will begin meetings in Cairo on Monday for the release of the remaining 20 hostages and a prisoner swap.  There is a lot of pressure on both sides to get a deal done, and special envoy Steve Wiktoff and Jared Kushner will be there to represent the U.S. Debora Patta reports from Israel.

title: A Pacific Gateway Shows the Kremlin’s Grip on Russia’s Vast Expanse
description: In a country where power is highly centralized, Moscow sets the tone for Vladivostok, 4,000 miles away, complicating longstanding ambitions to make it a trading powerhouse.

title: A Pacific Gateway Shows the Kremlin’s Grip on Russia’s Vast Expanse
description: In a country where power is highly centralized, Moscow sets the tone for Vladivostok, 4,000 miles away, complicating longstanding ambitions to make it a trading powerhouse.

title: Taliban says it will never hand over Bagram Air Base to US
description: The Taliban's chief spokesman has firmly rejected Donald Trump's push to "take back" Bagram Air Base in Afghanistan.

title: Russia Targets Ukraine’s Energy Infrastructure With Deadly Bombardment
description: At least five people were killed before dawn in another large-scale and wide-ranging assault.

title: Syria Chooses Its First Parliament Since End of Civil War
description: Syrians are voting indirectly, and President Ahmed al-Shara is appointing a third of the lawmakers. Still, some see this as a step forward after decades of dictatorship.

title: Not All National Parks Remain Open in the Shutdown. Here’s What to Know.
description: Some underground attractions are closed, and many outdoor sites have reduced their services.

title: Amid the Gaza War, Israel Is More Divided and Isolated Than Ever
description: The longest war of an endless Israeli-Palestinian conflict has come to challenge Israel’s own image and understanding of itself.

title: For Netanyahu, Trump’s Nod to Peace Puts Him in a Tough Spot
description: The Israeli leader thought he had a plan from the U.S. president that would have represented total victory over Hamas. Suddenly, it looks as though he might not get everything he wants.

title: Netanyahu Says Israel and Hamas Are on the Brink of a Hostage Deal
description: Both sides have reacted positively to a United States proposal for a cease-fire, but many details remain to be ironed out, including whether Hamas will disarm.

description: Some victims of the Cebu earthquake in the Philippines lived in homes that were supposed to withstand natural disasters.

description: Along with optimism that President Trump can lock Israel and Hamas into a deal, many expressed anxiety about being disappointed once more.

title: Netanyahu Defends Wartime Leadership, Saying Hostage Deal Is Within Reach
description: In a speech that lasted just minutes, the Israeli prime minister boasted that he had defied his critics to secure the release of the remaining hostages in Gaza.

title: Synagogue Attack Increases Pressure on Starmer in the U.K.
description: The prime minister vowed to rid the Labour Party of antisemitism. But a competing political reality, activist anger over the war in Gaza, has complicated that effort.

title: What You Want to See Emerge From the Canada Post Walkout
description: Newsletter readers shared their thoughts about the future of Canada’s postal service.

title: For the New Archbishop of Canterbury, Nursing Roots Could Bring a Pastoral Sensibility
description: As bishop of London, Sarah Mullally placed herself in the middle of the church’s most charged issues. But experts predict that her years treating cancer patients could inform how she approaches her new role.

title: Trump’s Gaza Plan: What We Know
description: It would end the war and secure the release of all hostages. Hamas would give up its arms and its power, while a transitional government is set up. Hamas has not agreed and the terms will be hard for it to swallow.

title: Russian Drones Hit 2 Passenger Trains, Ukraine Says
description: The drone strikes killed at least one person and injured dozens of others, officials said. The attack came amid rising alarm about the status of a nuclear plant relying solely on generators.

title: Ivan Klima, Czech Novelist Who Chafed Under Totalitarian Regimes, Dies at 94
description: A writer, dissident, teacher and critic, he was deeply affected by an early experience of his life: incarceration as a boy in a concentration camp near Prague.

title: French Photojournalist Killed in Drone Attack in Ukraine
description: Antoni Lallican, a Paris-based photographer, is the first working journalist to be killed by a remotely piloted drone during the war, according to press associations.

title: Israel says it has deported 137 flotilla activists amid large protests
description: The Global Sumud Flotilla set sail from Spain last month, with politicians and activists, including Greta Thunberg​, aboard.

title: Pharaoh's tomb in Egypt's Valley of the Kings reopens to the public
description: The huge tomb of Amenhotep III, who ruled ancient Egypt between 1390 B.C. and 1350 B.C., is carved into the hillside on the west bank of the Nile River in the southern Egyptian city of Luxor.

title: Sanae Takaichi Is Likely to Be Japan’s Next Leader. Who Is She?
description: Ms. Takaichi would be Japan’s first female prime minister in a country where women are drastically underrepresented at the highest levels of power.

title: Japan Is Set for Its First Female Prime Minister
description: Sanae Takaichi, a hard-line conservative, was elected as leader by Japan’s embattled governing party, paving the way for her to become prime minister of the coalition government.

title: Canada Post Strike Poses Challenges for Remote Communities
description: A strike, and growing prospects of drastic cuts to the state-owned postal service, make life very hard for Canada’s remote communities.

title: A Japanese Ski Resort Town Is Roiled by a Debate Over Immigration
description: Residents are protesting a planned housing facility for foreign workers, exposing the conflict between Japan’s need for labor and anxieties over immigration.

title: What to Know About Japan’s Leadership Election
description: Japan’s beleaguered governing party will convene for a crucial election that could pave the way for the first female prime minister or the youngest leader in 140 years.

description: The militant group responded to a proposal by President Trump to end the war in Gaza.

title: Trump Administration Is Said to Plan to Cut Refugee Admissions to a Record Low
description: Many of the slots would go to white South Africans and others facing “unjust discrimination,” according to people familiar with the matter and documents obtained by The New York Times.

title: Supreme Court Lets Trump Revoke Deportation Protections for Venezuelans
description: The Trump administration has tried to end deportation protections for more than 300,000 Venezuelan immigrants.

title: An Embarrassment of Riches for Mexico’s Party of the Poor
description: Mexico’s dominant party, Morena, rose to power by championing the poor. Now it is having to explain the luxurious lifestyles of some of its most prominent members.

title: Journalist Mario Guevara Is Deported After Being Held Over 100 Days
description: The Salvadoran journalist was arrested in June while covering a “No Kings” protest outside Atlanta. Those charges were dropped, his lawyers said.

title: How Fury Over Israel’s Qatar Attack Pushed Netanyahu on Gaza
description: Hamas has agreed to some elements of the proposal by President Trump to end the war in Gaza, but it’s not clear if its conditions ultimately would satisfy the White House or Israel.

title: Is South Korea’s ‘Buddhistcore’ Aesthetic a Fad or a Spiritual Awakening?
description: Young South Koreans are buying Buddhist merch. Monks and experts hope the buzz will translate into deeper engagement.

title: Trump Calls on Israel to Stop Bombing Gaza After Hamas Agrees to Parts of Cease-Fire Plan
description: President Trump said he believed Hamas was “ready for a lasting peace” after the militant group offered to release hostages and discuss the U.S.-led peace proposal.

title: U.S. Military Attacked Boat Off Venezuela, Killing Four Men, Hegseth Says
description: It was the fourth strike in the Trump administration’s legally disputed campaign targeting suspected drug runners in the Caribbean Sea.

title: Hamas Looks to Avoid ‘Take It or Leave It’ on Trump Proposal
description: A senior member of the Palestinian group said it would soon announce its position on President Trump’s plan to end the war in Gaza.

title: Trump and Carney to Hold Tariff and Security Talks in D.C.
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney of Canada will travel to Washington next week to meet with President Trump to try to ease some of the tariffs imposed by the United States.

title: Indian Comedian Kunal Kamra Forced Offstage Amid Political Censorship
description: The Indian comedian Kunal Kamra was forced offstage after a political joke led to a mob attack. Unlike Jimmy Kimmel, he is unlikely to return anytime soon.

title: Indonesia School Collapse Leaves Families Gripped by Grief and Fury
description: Four days after the collapse, families of the school’s students in East Java were in shock, demanding answers as the search for bodies churned on.

title: A.I. Is Driving a Stock Market Rally in China, Too
description: Surging interest in artificial intelligence is generating huge gains for Chinese tech stocks like Alibaba, which has more than doubled this year.

title: Texas Megachurch Pastor Pleads Guilty to Child Sex Abuse
description: Robert Morris, the founder of Gateway Church, which has one of the nation’s largest congregations, admitted to sexually abusing a child in the 1980s.

title: Philippines President Says Tents Needed to Shelter Earthquake Survivors
description: Officials were optimistic on Thursday that most of the missing had been accounted for. But severe damage to the area means many people lack shelter, water and electricity.

title: 3 Killed in Antigovernment Protests in Morocco
description: Demonstrators, mostly younger people, vented anger against heavy spending on preparations for the 2030 soccer World Cup instead of on public services.

title: At Saudi Comedy Festival, American Free Speech Becomes the Punchline
description: American comics used Saudi Arabia’s first global comedy festival to skewer a debate raging at home. Critics said the event was part of Saudi efforts to draw attention away from a political crackdown.

title: Democrats Pull Away From AIPAC, Reflecting a Broader Shift
description: A quiet retreat by Democrats from the pre-eminent pro-Israel lobbying group is the latest evidence of a realignment underway in Congress on Israel.

title: As Unrest in Pakistani Kashmir Turns Deadly, Prime Minister Urges Calm
description: Days of protest in the regional capital, set off by a convergence of rival marches, are fueled by familiar complaints like high prices and demands for electoral reform.

title: Israel Detains Activists After Intercepting Flotilla Headed to Gaza: What to Know
description: The Israeli government said it had detained activists who were trying to take humanitarian aid to the blockaded enclave.

title: What We Know About the Protests in Madagascar
description: A youth-led movement against the president of Madagascar is sustaining protests across the country. John Eligon, the Johannesburg bureau chief for The New York Times, explains what’s happened.

title: Madagascar’s President Rajoelina Dissolved His Government, but Calls for His Resignation Continue
description: A growing protest movement on the African island, despite deadly clashes with security forces, vows to keep fighting until Andry Rajoelina is ousted.

title: Many Palestinians Say Hamas Must Accept U.S. Cease-Fire Plan
description: Interviews in Gaza suggest wide support for a proposal that calls for an immediate end to a war that has brought immense civilian suffering.

title: How Finland remains Earth's happiest country
description: For the eighth consecutive year, Finland was ranked first as the happiest country on Earth, according to the annual World Happiness Report.

title: How Social Media Is Changing the Narrative of the Israel-Gaza War
description: Nearly two years into the conflict, social media is increasingly capturing the day-to-day toll in Gaza, as U.S. public opinion on the war shifts.

title: A Family’s Global Efforts to Free the Only Nepali Kidnapped by Hamas
description: A family’s campaign to free a student abducted from a rural Israeli town two years ago may be imperiled by an uprising in Nepal and stalled attempts at a cease-fire.

title: A Run on Canned Mackerel and Emergency Radios. The Reason? Drones.
description: The Danish public has been unsettled by a wave of mysterious drone incursions, which has underscored the country’s vulnerability.

title: Congo’s Former President Sentenced to Death in Absentia
description: Joseph Kabila, who was president of the Democratic Republic of Congo for 18 years, was convicted of treason by a court in Kinshasa.

title: Israel Intercepts Boats Headed to Gaza With Humanitarian Aid
description: The boats were part of a flotilla, carrying Greta Thunberg and other activists, that was organized to break Israel’s blockade and protest the war.

title: South African Politician Julius Malema, Subject of Trump Attacks, Is Convicted of Gun Charge
description: The verdict against Julius Malema came a month after a separate court convicted him of hate speech. This year, President Trump played a video montage at the White House of Mr. Malema leading chants of “Kill the Boer,” a protest song.

title: ‘She Could Have Killed Me’: Scientist Survives Shark Bite to His Head
description: “My whole head was inside of her mouth,” Mauricio Hoyos, a marine scientist from Mexico, said from a hospital in Costa Rica.

title: Gaza City Exodus Is Overwhelming Relief Efforts, Aid Agencies Say
description: The hundreds of thousands of Palestinians fleeing Israel’s expanded ground offensive are further straining services, aid groups say. Hospitals are overflowing, water is low and diseases are spreading.

title: I Interviewed a Doctor in Sudan. Days Later, He Was Killed.
description: Dr. Omar Selik’s raw, urgent testimony from a besieged city cut through the fog of war and crystallized the depravity of the conflict. And then he was gone.

title: Tony Blair, Tapped by Trump for Gaza Plan, Brings Peace Expertise and Baggage
description: After helping negotiate peace in Northern Ireland, the former prime minister’s reputation was tarnished by his role in the U.S.-led invasion of Iraq. Is he stepping into another diplomatic quagmire?

title: Israel Escalates Gaza Offensive as Hamas Mulls Trump Plan
description: Hundreds of thousands of Palestinians have fled Israel’s assault on Gaza City, but many are believed to remain, having nowhere to go or no means to leave.

title: The Artist Ana Segovia Wants You to Look Closer at that Cowboy
description: The Mexican painter is a master at directing viewers’ gaze. Now, he is using that power to turn gender roles and machismo upside-down.

title: U.N. Security Council Approves Larger Force to Fight Gangs in Haiti
description: The vote on Tuesday would establish a force of up to 5,500 soldiers and police officers. It was unclear what countries were willing to contribute personnel or money.

title: Irish Hotelier Accuses Qatari Royals of Scheme to Get Free Labor
description: A lawsuit accuses members of the emirate’s ruling family of stringing the Irish hotelier, Patrick McKillen, along on high-end developments as “part of a yearslong pattern of illegal racketeering.”

title: Trump Promises to Defend Qatar, a Reassurance After Israel’s Strike
description: An executive order says an attack on Qatar would be treated as a threat to the U.S., bolstering security commitments to a key Gulf ally after Israel’s strike on Doha last month.

title: U.S. Deports Planeload of Iranians After Deal With Tehran, Officials Say
description: The deportation flight is one of the clearest signals yet of the Trump administration’s determination to expel migrants, even to places with harsh human rights conditions.

title: With New U.S. Proposal to End Gaza War, a Rare Moment of Triumph for Netanyahu
description: In President Trump’s plan, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu got almost everything he hoped for in the end, despite mounting international isolation.

title: Ambassador Mike Huckabee Postpones Rare Visit to Egypt
description: Ambassador Huckabee said the delay was requested by Egyptian officials. The trip is now expected to take place in the coming weeks.

title: Madagascar’s President Dissolves Government Amid Deadly Protests
description: Andry Rajoelina, the leader of the island nation in Africa, acknowledged grievances over power cuts and water shortages that have drawn thousands of young people to the streets.

description: The United States has blown up several boats in the Caribbean Sea and is now increasing its military presence off the coast of Venezuela. Julie Turkewitz, reporting from Caracas, explains how Venezuelans are reacting.

description: More than a third of Etosha National Park in Namibia has burned, threatening the rich biodiversity in a popular tourist attraction.

description: Donald Trump has laid out a 20-point peace plan for Gaza – but what does it actually say, and will it work?

description: Postal workers walked off the job to protest cost-cutting measures ordered by the government that are likely to lead to major job losses.

title: Colombia’s President Reinforces Common Stereotype, Sparking Widespread Backlash
description: An offhand comment by President Gustavo Petro of Colombia about men with a stigmatized first name has set off a backlash and broader discussions over classism.

description: Brazil’s fast and free homegrown digital payment system, PIX, has become wildly popular. The Trump administration says it unfairly undercuts U.S. companies.

description: On a visit to Venezuela, The Times found a nation bracing for potential U.S. military action.

description: Immigration kiosks were offline for hours at major airports and some passengers said they were stranded on planes. The outage was resolved early Monday.

description: “Ask a Correspondent” will take your questions to Peter Baker, our chief White House correspondent.

title: Kerry James Marshall on Making ‘the Paintings Nobody Else Is Making’
description: The artist’s blockbuster survey across nearly five decades at the Royal Academy of Art in London tackles Black history in all its complexity.

title: Gambians Say, ‘Thank You’ After U.S. Denied Local Officials Visas to Attend U.N. Gathering
description: Gambians who see officials’ attendance at international events as taxpayer-funded vacations were grateful when some officials were refused U.S. entry for the U.N. General Assembly.

title: Malawi President Concedes Election to His Predecessor
description: The concession from President Lazarus Chakwera came despite reports of irregularities at the polls. Final results showed that Peter Mutharika had won nearly 57 percent of the vote.

title: Philanthropies Strike a Promising Deal to Turn Back H.I.V.
description: Low- and middle-income countries will be able to purchase an effective preventative at a reduced price. The arrangements may help stem the epidemic 40 years after it began.

title: U.S. Deportee Sent to Africa Is Repatriated by Jamaica
description: The decision by the Trump administration to send Orville Etoria to Eswatini, where he had no ties, raised alarm among rights groups.

title: Peter Mutharika Set to Return to Power in Malawi
description: Peter Mutharika, an 85-year-old Yale-educated law professor, looked on course to defeat the incumbent, Lazarus Chakwera.

title: Burkina Faso, Mali and Niger Leaving International Criminal Court
description: The military rulers of Burkina Faso, Mali and Niger said the court had become a tool of neocolonial repression. All three governments have been accused of human rights violations.

title: Trump Claims Again at the U.N. That He Ended 7 Wars. Here’s a Closer Look.
description: During his speech, the president also disparaged the work of the United Nations, which, he said, “did not even try to help” in any of the conflicts.

title: Guterres Says the U.N.’s Principles ‘Are Under Siege.’
description: Tidak ada deskripsi

title: Why African Countries Keep Making Deals to Accept U.S. Deportees
description: As the Trump administration exerts pressure on countries to aid in its mass deportation efforts, some nations in Africa have agreed, prompting legal battles.

title: Young musicians are living their dreams, thanks to a recycled orchestra
description: Once known as trash pickers, residents of a poor village in Paraguay are now playing in music halls around the world, with instruments made entirely of trash
